Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating Africa's education spending by stating that it is the highest percentage of GDP of any part of the world.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide specific data or sources to support the statement that Africa has the highest percentage of GDP spent on education.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that high education spending will automatically lead to the creation of a middle class and economic growth in Africa.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that may contribute to Africa's education spending, such as population size or government priorities.
